{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3119785,"name":"Ido Sobol","username":"sobol","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sobol/{size}/231603_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-08T18:35:01.005Z","cooked":"

Hello,
Our team has used NT 3 in our custom Dashboard and in our image processing with
pynetworktables.
It seems like the 2023 WPIlib updates force us to change to NT 4, but the current pynetworktables version doesn‚Äôt support NT 4.
We wanted to ask if there is an option to stick with NT 3, or if when pynetworktables will be updated to NT 4.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-01-08T18:35:01.005Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":98,"reads":161,"readers_count":160,"score":522.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":421579,"topic_slug":"migrating-to-nt-4","display_username":"Ido Sobol","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51071,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/migrating-to-nt-4/421579/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3119794,"name":"Joe Ross","username":"Joe_Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-08T18:39:11.162Z","cooked":"

From RobotPy 2023 is now available it sounds like pynetworktables was replaced with pyntcore.

However, a NT 3 client can connect to and work with an NT 4 server.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-01-08T18:39:11.162Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":158,"readers_count":157,"score":96.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":421579,"topic_slug":"migrating-to-nt-4","display_username":"Joe Ross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/robotpy-2023-is-now-available/420979","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"RobotPy 2023 is now available","clicks":12}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":65,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/migrating-to-nt-4/421579/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3119796,"name":"Weaver Goldman","username":"GoldMonster","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/goldmonster/{size}/154153_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-08T18:40:32.786Z","cooked":"

You can use pyntcore now, as was previously mentioned. You can also use a JavaScript websocket client. See here: gerth2/NetworkTablesClients: NT Client implementations for multiple languages (github.com)

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-01-08T18:40:32.786Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":150,"readers_count":149,"score":55.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":421579,"topic_slug":"migrating-to-nt-4","display_username":"Weaver Goldman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/gerth2/NetworkTablesClients","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - gerth2/NetworkTablesClients: NT Client implementations for multiple languages","clicks":16}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Calvin and Hobbes connoisseur"},"post_url":"/t/migrating-to-nt-4/421579/3","custom_user_title":"Calvin and Hobbes connoisseur","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3120339,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-09T01:53:36.392Z","cooked":"

As mentioned, pynetworktables can continue talking to NT4 servers, you just won‚Äôt get any of the cool features of NT4.
